common.alias_description: A task alias can be used instead of the name or task ID. Only dashes, underscores, and alphanumeric characters are supported. The task alias must be unique among all your tasks.
common.config_entry_description: Select the Habitica account to update a task.
common.developer_options_description: Additional features available in developer mode.
common.notes_description: The new notes for the Habitica task.
common.remove_tag_description: Remove tags from the Habitica task.
common.rename_description: The new title for the Habitica task.
common.tag_description: Add tags to the Habitica task. If a tag does not already exist, a new one will be created.
common.tag_options_description: Add or remove tags from a task.
common.task_description: The name (or task ID) of the task you want to update.

abort.unique_id_mismatch: Hmm, those login details are correct, but they're not for this adventurer. Got another account to try?

error.invalid_credentials: Input is incomplete. You must provide either your login details or an API token

data_description.api_key: API Token of the Habitica account
data_description.api_user: User ID of your Habitica account
data_description.url: URL of the Habitica installation to connect to. Defaults to `{default_url}`
data_description.verify_ssl: Enable SSL certificate verification for secure connections. Disable only if connecting to a Habitica instance using a self-signed certificate

data_description.password: Password for the account to connect Home Assistant to Habitica
data_description.username: Email or username (case-sensitive) to connect Home Assistant to your Habitica account

login.description:
Enter your login details to start using Habitica with Home Assistant

[Forgot your password?]({forgot_password})

reauth_confirm.description: ![Habiticans]({habiticans}) It seems your API token for **{name}** has been reset. To re-authorise the integration, you can either log in with your username or email, and password, or directly provide your new API token.

data_description.api_key: API Token of the Habitica account

reauth_api_key.description: Enter your new API token below. You can find it in Habitica under 'Settings -> Site Data'
reauth_api_key.name: Re-authorise via API Token

data_description.password: Password for the account to connect Home Assistant to Habitica
data_description.username: Email or username (case-sensitive) to connect Home Assistant to your Habitica account

reauth_login.description: Enter your login details below to re-authorise the Home Assistant integration with Habitica
reauth_login.name: Re-authorise via login

reauth_confirm.title: Re-authorise {name} with Habitica

data_description.api_key: API Token of the Habitica account

reconfigure.description:
![Habiticans]({habiticans})

Enter your new API token below. You can find it in Habitica under [**Settings -> Site Data**]({site_data})

data_description.verify_ssl: Enable SSL certificate verification for secure connections. Disable only if connecting to a Habitica instance using a self-signed certificate

danger_zone.description: These settings impact core functionality. Modifications are unnecessary if connected to the official Habitica instance and may disrupt the integration. Proceed with caution.
danger_zone.name: Critical configuration options

reconfigure.title: Update Habitica configuration

authentication_failed.message: Authentication failed. It looks like your API token has been reset. Please re-authenticate using your new token

entry_not_loaded.message: The selected character is currently not loaded or disabled in Home Assistant.

frequency_not_monthly.message: Unable to update task, monthly repeat settings apply only to monthly recurring dailies.

frequency_not_weekly.message: Unable to update task, weekly repeat settings apply only to weekly recurring dailies.

item_not_found.message: Unable to use {item}, you don't own this item.

not_enough_gold.message: Unable to buy reward, not enough gold. Your character has {gold}, but the reward costs {cost}.

party_not_found.message: Unable to find target, you are currently not in a party. You can only target yourself.

quest_action_unallowed.message: Action not allowed, only quest leader or group leader can perform this action

quest_not_found.message: Unable to complete action, quest or group not found

skill_not_found.message: Unable to cast skill, your character does not have the skill or spell {skill}.

target_not_found.message: Unable to find target {target} in your party

task_not_found.message: Unable to complete action, could not find the task {task}

deprecated_api_call.description:
The Habitica action `habitica.api_call` is deprecated and will be removed in Home Assistant 2025.5.0.

Please update your automations and scripts to use other Habitica actions and entities.
deprecated_api_call.title: The Habitica action habitica.api_call is deprecated

deprecated_entity.description:
The Habitica entity `{entity}` is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.
Please update your automations and scripts, disable `{entity}` and reload the integration/restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.
deprecated_entity.title: The Habitica {name} entity is deprecated

abort_quest.description: Terminates your party's ongoing quest. All progress will be lost and the quest roll returned to the owner's inventory. Only quest leader or group leader can perform this action.

config_entry.description: Choose the Habitica character for which to perform the action.
config_entry.name: Select character

abort_quest.name: Abort an active quest

accept_quest.description: Accepts a pending invitation to a quest.

config_entry.description: Choose the Habitica character for which to perform the action.
config_entry.name: Select character

accept_quest.name: Accept a quest invitation

args.description: Any additional JSON or URL parameter arguments. See apidoc mentioned for path. Example uses same API endpoint.
args.name: Args

path.description: Items from API URL in form of an array with method attached at the end. Consult https://habitica.com/apidoc/. Example uses https://habitica.com/apidoc/#api-Task-CreateUserTasks.

cancel_quest.description: Cancels a quest that has not yet started. All accepted and pending invitations will be cancelled and the quest roll returned to the owner's inventory. Only quest leader or group leader can perform this action.

config_entry.description: Choose the Habitica character for which to perform the action.
config_entry.name: Select character

cancel_quest.name: Cancel a pending quest

cast_skill.description: Uses a skill or spell from your Habitica character on a specific task to affect its progress or status.

config_entry.description: Choose the Habitica character to cast the skill.
config_entry.name: Select character

skill.description: Select the skill or spell you want to cast on the task. Only skills corresponding to your character's class can be used.
skill.name: Skill

get_tasks.description: Retrieves tasks from your Habitica character.

config_entry.description: Choose the Habitica character to retrieve tasks from.
config_entry.name: Select character

keyword.description: Filter tasks by keyword, searching across titles, notes, and checklists.
keyword.name: Keyword

tag.description: Filter tasks that have one or more of the selected tags.
tag.name: Tag

task.description: Select tasks by matching their name (or task ID).
task.name: Task name

get_tasks.name: Get tasks

filter.description: Use the optional filters to narrow the returned tasks.
filter.name: Filter options

leave_quest.description: Leaves the current quest you are participating in.

config_entry.description: Choose the Habitica character for which to perform the action.
config_entry.name: Select character

leave_quest.name: Leave a quest

reject_quest.description: Rejects a pending invitation to a quest.

config_entry.description: Choose the Habitica character for which to perform the action.
config_entry.name: Select character

reject_quest.name: Reject a quest invitation

score_habit.description: Increases the positive or negative streak of a habit to track its progress.

config_entry.description: Select the Habitica character tracking your habit.
config_entry.name: Select character

direction.description: Is it positive or negative progress you want to track for your habit.
direction.name: Reward or loss

task.description: The name (or task ID) of the Habitica habit.
task.name: Habit name

score_habit.name: Track a habit

score_reward.description: Buys one of your custom rewards with gold earned by fulfilling tasks.

config_entry.description: Select the Habitica character buying the reward.
config_entry.name: Select character

task.description: The name (or task ID) of the custom reward.
task.name: Reward name

score_reward.name: Buy a reward

start_quest.description: Begins the quest immediately, bypassing any pending invitations that haven't been accepted or rejected. Only quest leader or group leader can perform this action.

config_entry.description: Choose the Habitica character for which to perform the action.
config_entry.name: Select character

start_quest.name: Force-start a pending quest

transformation.description: Uses a transformation item from your Habitica character's inventory on a member of your party or yourself.

config_entry.description: Choose the Habitica character to use the transformation item.
config_entry.name: Select character

item.description: Select the transformation item you want to use. Item must be in the characters inventory.
item.name: Transformation item

target.description: The name of the character you want to use the transformation item on. You can also specify the players username or user ID.
target.name: Target character

transformation.name: Use a transformation item

update_reward.description: Updates a specific reward for the selected Habitica character
